section1.p: Many parts of the XMPP ecosystem use cryptographic functions. While ciphers used in established protocols are carefully selected to provide a maximum of security, it might happen that certain functions become unsecure (because of technical advances or because of disclosed security issues). In such a case it is favorable to be able to quickly replace the cipher in question with another one. However, in many cases XEPs have hard dependencies on ciphers. This XEP aims to provide a unique way to identify cipher configurations using a fixed namespace, so that XEPs can provide the option to use different ciphers in a more flexible way.
